sentence.Network_en: My mother always made me feel I wasn't coming up to scratch.
sentence.Network_cn: 母亲总是使我觉得自己不够优秀。

sentence.Network_en: Building a home from scratch can be both exciting and challenging.
sentence.Network_cn: 建立一个全新的家庭既让人兴奋又富于挑战。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to suggest that an investigation of someone or something soon reveals their true nature
jx.jx_cn_mean: [指揭露某人（或某事）真面目的调查]除去…的假象你将发现…的本质

lj.lj_ly: they believe that if you scratch a homophobe, you'll probably find a racist.
lj.lj_ls: 他们确信如果你剥去一个厌恶同性恋者的外衣，一个种族主义者的真面目就会暴露无遗。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)think hard in order to find a solution to something
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)冥思苦想问题的解答

jx.jx_en_mean: deal with a matter only in the most superficial way

lj.lj_ly: research has only scratched the surface of the paranormal.
lj.lj_ls: 研究仅涉及超正常范围的表面。

jx.jx_en_mean: initiate the briefest investigation to discover something concealed

lj.lj_ly: they have a boring image but scratch the surface and it's fascinating.
lj.lj_ls: 它们有种令人生厌的形象，可是一旦调查起来，却很令人着迷。

jx.jx_en_mean: up to the required standard; satisfactory

lj.lj_ly: her German was not up to scratch.

phrase.cizu_name: you scratch my back and I'll scratch yours

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)if you do me a favour, I'll return it
jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)你帮我，我帮你；投我以桃，报之以李

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: probably a blend of the synonymous dialect words scrat and cratch, both of uncertain origin; compare with Middle Low German kratsen and Old High German krazzōn

entry.def: If you scratch yourself, you rub your fingernails against your skin because it is itching.

example.ex: He scratched himself under his arm...
The old man lifted his cardigan to scratch his side...
example.tran: 老人撩起开襟毛衣挠了挠身体的一侧。

entry.def: If a sharp object scratches someone or something, it makes small shallow cuts on their skin or surface.

example.ex: The branches tore at my jacket and scratched my hands and face...
example.tran: 树枝刮破了我的夹克，划伤了我的手和脸。
小刀会在工作台上留下划痕。

entry.def: Scratches on someone or something are small shallow cuts.

example.ex: The seven-year-old was found crying with scratches on his face and neck...
example.tran: 那名 7 岁男孩被发现时正在哭泣，脸部和颈部都有划伤。

example.ex: I pointed to a number of scratches in the tile floor.
example.tran: 我指向地板砖上的一道道划痕。

entry.tran: 从零开始;从头做起;白手起家
entry.def: If you do something from scratch, you do it without making use of anything that has been done before.

example.ex: Building a home from scratch can be both exciting and challenging...
example.tran: 建立一个全新的家庭既让人兴奋又富于挑战。

example.ex: Hong Kong's manufacturing industry did not start from scratch in the post-war period.
example.tran: 战后，香港制造业的兴起并非从零开始。

entry.def: If you say that someone is scratching their head, you mean that they are thinking hard and trying to solve a problem or puzzle.

example.ex: The Institute spends a lot of time scratching its head about how to boost American productivity.
example.tran: 该协会花费大量时间苦苦思索如何提高美国的生产力。

entry.tran: 触及表面;隔靴搔痒;浅尝辄止
entry.def: If you only scratch the surface of a subject or problem, you find out or do a small amount, but not enough to understand or solve it.

example.ex: Officials say they've only scratched the surface of the drug problem...
example.tran: 官员们说他们只是触及了毒品问题的表面。

example.ex: We had only two weeks to tour Malaysia, which was hardly enough time to scratch the surface.
example.tran: 我们只有两周的时间游览马来西亚，连走马观花都来不及。

entry.tran: 达到标准;合格;令人满意
entry.def: If you say that someone or something is not up to scratch, you mean that they are not good enough.

example.ex: My mother always made me feel I wasn't coming up to scratch.
example.tran: 母亲总是使我觉得自己不够优秀。

means.word_mean: 1. an abraded area where the skin is torn or worn off
2. a depression scratched or carved into a surface
5. a harsh noise made by scraping;

sentences.sentence: "the scrape of violin bows distracted her"

means.word_mean: 2. cut the surface of; wear away the surface of
3. scrape or rub as if to relieve itching;

list.explanation: 从零开始，从点滴做起，白手起家

example.en: We had to do it all again, from scratch.
example.zh: 我们只好全部再做一遍，从头开始。

example.en: His from-scratch enterprise failed in his ventures.
example.zh: 他白手起家的企业投机失败了。

list.explanation: 够水平的，满意的，合格，处于良好状态的

example.en: I'm afraid this story isn't quite up to scratch.
example.zh: 我看这篇报道恐怕未必合用。

auth_sentence.content: Nice scratch on her bright shiny car, though.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Nice scratch on her bright shiny car, though.

auth_sentence.content: It's not like they're starting from scratch.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's not like they're starting from scratch.

auth_sentence.res_content: Scratch has gotten quite aggressive about the whole thing.

Sentence.sentence: He didn't want to start from scratch.

sentences.en: He has a curious habit of scratching his ear while he speaks.
sentences.cn: 他有一种奇怪的习惯, 一讲话就搔耳朵。

sentences.en: I hope you are not going to scratch me.
sentences.cn: 我希望你不会把我的名字从比赛中划去。

sentences.en: His dog just gives a scratch at the door when it wants to come in.
sentences.cn: 他的狗想进来时就用爪子抓门。

sentences.en: Her face was covered with scratches.
I heard the scratches on the old records.
sentences.cn: 我听到旧唱片的沙沙声。

jushi.chinese: 这支钢笔钩纸钩得利害。

jushi.english: The cat has scratched a hole in the flowerbed.
jushi.chinese: 猫在花坛上扒了一个坑。
